sn2.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn2.1:1.3: Then, late at night, the glorious god Kassapa, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,
sn2.1:1.4: “The Buddha has revealed the mendicant, but not his instructions to a mendicant.”
sn2.1:1.5: “Well then, Kassapa, clarify this matter yourself.”
sn2.1:2.1: “They should train in following good advice,
sn2.1:2.3: in sitting alone in hidden places,
sn2.1:3.1: That’s what the god Kassapa said,
sn2.1:3.3: Then Kassapa, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
